allow: Bash(# Find what worktree hash 6b3e9b7a corresponds to docker inspect claude-yolo-6b3e9b7a-android --format ''{{range .Config.Env}}{{println .}}{{end}}'')

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix UTC timezone bug in uptime/age display, improve install docs

Docker timestamps are UTC but macOS date -jf parsed them as local
time, producing negative uptimes. Added -u flag to date parsing in
both container_uptime\(\) and image_age_days\(\).

Also clarified the shell alias install step in README.
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Address Copilot review: find arg order, SDK checksum, mktemp portability

- Reorder find flags \(-maxdepth before -name\) for GNU find compat
- Add SHA256 verification for Android SDK command-line tools download
- Use explicit mktemp template for BSD/GNU portability in tests
EOF
\)")
Bash(/Users/me/work/claude-yolo/bin/claude-yolo --yolo --strategy rust -- --print "run gh api user -q .login && echo GH_API_OK")

Bash(# Check that container''s state docker inspect --format ''{{.State.Status}} exit={{.State.ExitCode}}'' claude-yolo-955010d3-generic || echo ""container not found"" # Also check the recent container that was running during our tests docker ps -a --format ''{{.Names}}\\t{{.Status}}'')

Bash(# Start the generic container and check the claude binary inside it docker start claude-yolo-955010d3-generic && \\ docker exec claude-yolo-955010d3-generic which claude && \\ docker exec claude-yolo-955010d3-generic claude --version && \\ docker exec claude-yolo-955010d3-generic ls -la /usr/local/bin/claude || \\ docker exec claude-yolo-955010d3-generic ls /home/claude/.npm)

Bash(# Check the exit code of the container that just exited docker inspect --format ''{{.State.ExitCode}} {{.State.Status}} {{.State.OOMKilled}}'' claude-yolo-955010d3-generic # Also check what the container shows for recent log output docker logs --tail 20 claude-yolo-955010d3-generic 2>&1)

Bash(# Clear the junk text in Claude''s input by pressing Escape and Ctrl+U tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" Escape tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" C-u sleep 1 tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" ""/login"" Enter sleep 5 tmux capture-pane -t ""fix-test"" -p)

Bash(# Multiple escapes to clear, then Ctrl+A, then Ctrl+K to kill line, then retype tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" Escape Escape Escape sleep 0.5 tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" C-a sleep 0.2 tmux send-keys -t ""fix-test"" C-k sleep 0.5 tmux capture-pane -t ""fix-test"" -p)
